intro: Rhombospora sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran rhombospora, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
